definition[0]: to make a hole or passage in the ground
example[0]: Mother turtles burrow into the sand to lay their eggs.
definition[1]: to press your body close to someone or under something because you want to get warm or feel safe
example[1]: The child stirred and burrowed deeper into the bed.
example[2]: She burrowed her head into his shoulder.
definition[2]: to search for something that is hidden in a container or under other things
example[3]: Helen burrowed in her bag for a handkerchief.
definition[3]: a passage in the ground made by an animal such as a rabbit or fox as a place to live
